messageBody:
Based on your description...

On Dec 6, 2007 12:21 PM, Lee B <leeb@...> wrote:
>
> TestsSuperclass
> @BeforeClass
> public static void startup() {
> ...do startup stuff, using one piece of info from currently running
> subclass
> }
>
> I don't see any way to get info from the subclass into that startup
> method.
>

...why couldn't you do something similar to the following? Factor the
"something" into a superclass static method (with a different name)
and then invoke it from a static @BeforeTest method on each subclass
(which passes the "one piece of info" from the subclass).

-jn-


public class SuperTest {

public static class Info { /* whatever */ }

public static void something(Info info) {
// do startup stuff with info
}

}

public class SubTest0 extends SuperTest {
static SuperTest.Info info0 = new SuperTest.Info( /*whatever*/ );

@BeforeClass
public static void startup() { something(info0); }

}

public class SubTest1 extends SuperTest {
static SuperTest.Info info1 = new SuperTest.Info("sub1");

@BeforeClass
public static void startup() { something(info1); }

}
